title: Unidentified Girl in Backyard of Truman Home
Scopenote: An unidentified girl (about ten years old) in the backyard of the Truman home at 219 N. Delaware.  George Wallace house is in the background.  From an original negative.  From:  Truman house.

title: Backyard of 219 N. Delaware, the Truman Home
Scopenote: Snapshot of backyard of 219 N. Delaware, the Truman house, looking from the southeast.  From:  Truman house.

title: Backyard of 219 N. Delaware, the Truman Home
Scopenote: Snapshot of backyard of 219 N. Delaware, the Truman house.  From:  Truman house.

title: Young Woman in Backyard of Truman Home
Scopenote: An unidentified young woman in the backyard of the Truman home at 219. N. Delaware.  The arbor is in the background.  From original negative.  From:  Truman house.

title: Portrait of Paul H. Nitze
Scopenote: Portrait of Paul H. Nitze which was used in his oral history interview.  Credit: Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Harry S. Truman's identity card for the American Expeditionary Forces
Scopenote: Portrait of Captain Harry S. Truman, taken from his identity card for the American Expeditionary Forces.  His rank is Captain, 129 Field Artillery. Captain Truman is not wearing glasses in this straight frontal, unsmiling portrait.

title: Bess Wallace Truman with Baby Margaret Truman
Scopenote: Bess Wallace Truman on the porch of her family home at 219 North Delaware, holding baby Margaret Truman. This picture was taken the same year Margaret was born.  From:  Truman house.

title: Margaret Truman in Yard of Truman Home
Scopenote: Sun Streaked Snapshot of Margaret Truman on a lawn chair in the backyard of the Truman home.  A bird bath is in the background.  From:  Truman house.

title: Sun Streaked Snapshot of Side of Truman Home
Scopenote: Sun streaked snapshot of side yard of the Truman house at 219 N. Delaware.    From:  Truman house.

title: Backyard View of Truman Home
Scopenote: Snapshot of backyard view through the arbor in the Truman home toward the George Wallace house.    From:  Truman house.

title: Sun Streaked Snapshot of Front of Truman Home
Scopenote: A sun streaked snapshot of the front view of the Truman home at 219 N. Delaware.    From:  Truman house.

title: Back Steps of Truman Home
Scopenote: Snapshot of the back steps of the Truman home at 219 N. Delaware.    From:  Truman house.

title: Sun Streaked Snapshot of Front of Truman Home
Scopenote: Sun streaked snapshot of the front of the Truman home at 219 N. Delaware.    From:  Truman house.

title: Sun Streaked Snapshot of Backyard of Truman Home
Scopenote: Sun streaked snapshot of the backyard of the Truman home.  From:  Truman house.

title: Backyard of Truman Home
Scopenote: Snapshot of backyard and back area of the Truman home at 219 N. Delaware.  From:  Truman house.

title: Margaret Truman's Playground in Backyard of Truman Home
Scopenote: Snapshot of Margaret Truman's playground in the backyard of the Truman home at 219 N. Delaware.  From:  Truman house.

title: Portrait of Regna Vanatta
Scopenote: Portrait of Regna Vanatta used in her oral history interview.  Regna Vanatta is standing in front of the Vanatta store.  Donor: Ms. Vanatta.

title: Portrait of Frank W. Fetter
Scopenote: Portrait of Frank W. Fetter used in his oral history interview.  Worked with the Office of the Lend-Lease Administration, 1943-1944; Department of State, 1944-1946.  Donor: Mr. Fetter.

title: Portrait of W. John Kenney
Scopenote: Portrait of W. John Kenney which was used in his oral History interview. Special Assistant to Under Secretary of the Navy, Chairman, Navy Price Adjustment Board, and General Counsel, 1941-46; Under Secretary of Navy, 1947-49; Chief of Mission, Economic Cooperation Administration, in England, 1949-50; Deputy Director for Mutual Security, 1952.

title: Margaret Truman in Backyard of Truman House
Scopenote: Margaret Truman bending over flowers in the backyard of 219 N. Delaware.  This is from an original negative.  It is slightly sun streaked.  From:  Truman house.

title: Bess Truman and Her Three Brothers in White House
Scopenote: Family portrait of First Lady Bess Truman and her three brothers, probably taken at the White House during Christmas. Left to right: Frank Wallace, Fred Wallace, Bess Truman, and George Wallace. This photo is from an original negative. From: Truman house.

title: Harry S. Truman and relatives in the family quarters of the White House
Scopenote: Left to right:  Marian Wallace, May Wallace, Mary Jane Truman, Christine Wallace, and Harry S. Truman looking at photographs in the family quarters of the White House during Christmas, 1947.  Photograph is from original negative from the Truman home.

title: Harry and Bess Truman in family quarters of White House
Scopenote: Good snapshot of Harry and Bess Truman in family quarters of the White House.    The photograph is from an original negative from the Truman home.

title: Truman and Wallace Families at the White House for Christmas Dinner
Scopenote: Christmas dinner at the White House.  Around the table from the left end:  Fred Wallace, Madge Gates Wallace, Natalie Wallace, Marian Wallace, First Lady Bess Truman, David Wallace, Christine Wallace, Frank Wallace, George Wallace, Mary Jane Truman, President Harry S. Truman. The servants standing in the background are unidentified. This photo is from an original negative found in the Truman home.  From:  Truman home.

title: Berlin Airlift planes at Templehof Airport
Scopenote: Overview of Templehof Airport, Berlin, Germany, with the airplanes lined up for the Berlin Airlift.

title: Madge Gates Wallace with Grandchild Margo Wallace
Scopenote: Madge Gates Wallace (mother of Bess Truman) holding baby Margo Wallace (her grandchild) in the living room of 219 N. Delaware, Christmas, 1948.  From:  Truman house.

title: President Truman and Family at Dinner at Blair House
Scopenote: Small snapshot of a family dinner at Blair House, probably around the time of the 1949 inauguration.  Left to right around table:  Frank Wallace, David Wallace, George Wallace, Natalie Wallace (partially obscured), May Wallace (partially obscured), President Harry S. Truman (drinking from glass), and Fred Wallace.  A butler can be seen at the end of the table.  From:  Truman house.

title: Portrait of William H. Foster
Scopenote: Portrait of William H. Foster, which was used in his oral history interview.  Mr. Foster was an acquaintance of President Harry S. Truman and retired university professor.  He is also the son of David K. Foster, a Baptist minister who hosted Harry S. Truman during appearances in Caruthersville, Missouri, from 1934 onwards.  Donor: William H. Foster.

title: Portrait of W. Walton Butterworth
Scopenote: Portrait of W. Walton Butterworth which was used in his oral History interview. U.S. Department of State, 1928-68. Foreign Service officer and career Ambassador. Among other posts and appointments as Ambassador served as counselor of Embassy, Madrid, Spain, 1944-46; counselor of Embassy with rank of Minister, Nanking, China, 1946-47; director for Far Eastern Affairs, Department of State, 1947-49; Assistant Secretary of State, 1949-50; and U.S. Ambassador to Sweden, 1950-53.

title: Portrait of General Lord Robertson of Oakridge
Scopenote: Portrait of General Lord Robertson of Oakridge which was used in his oral history interview.  During the administration of President Harry S. Truman, he was Deputy Military Governor, Germany, 1945-1948; Commander-in-Chief and Military Governor, 1948-1949; United Kingdom High Commissioner, Allied High Commission, Germany, 1949-1950; and Commander-in-Chief, Middle East Land Forces, 1950-1953.

title: Portrait of Russell L. Babb
Scopenote: Portrait of Russell L. Babb used in his oral history interview.  Mr. Babb was an aircraft pilot for Oklahoma State University, and, principally, for Dr. Henry Bennett, President of the State University and administrator (1951) of the Technical Cooperation Administration ("Point Four") in the U. S. Department of State.  Donor: Mr. Babb.

title: Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman Reading on Balcony of White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess Truman read books on the "Truman balcony" of White House. This is from a series of four original 35mm color slides. The slides are from the Truman home. This was copied from original slide SL2295.

title: Bess Truman Reading on Truman Balcony of White House
Scopenote: Bess Truman reading on the balcony of the south portico of the White House, the "Truman Balcony."  Harry S. Truman is partially obscured at left. This is from original slide SL2296.  From:  Truman house.

title: Truman family on steps of White House
Scopenote: From left to right: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman on the steps of the White House on President Truman's birthday.  From: Truman Home.

title: Portrait of C. Tyler Wood
Scopenote: Portrait of C. Tyler Wood, which was used in his oral history interview.  During the administration of President Harry S. Truman, Wood served as special assistant to the Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, alternate member U.N.R.R.A. council, 1945-1946; deputy to Assistant Secretary of State, 1947-1948; Assistant to Deputy Administrator, Economic Cooperation Administration, 1948-1949; Assistant Administrator for Operations, 1949-1950; Deputy U.S. Special Representative to Europe, 1950-1952; Associate Deputy Director, Mutual Security Agency, 1952-1953.  Donor: C. Tyler Wood.

title: Portrait of Harding Bancroft
Scopenote: Portrait of Harding Bancroft which was used in his oral History interview. Chief, Division of United Nations Political Affairs, Department of State, 1945, later Director, Office of United Nations Political and Security Affairs; U.S. Deputy Representative U.N. Collective Measures Committee with personal rank of Minister, 1950-53. Served as an assistant to the U.N. commission that investigated the Greek crisis in 1947.

title: Portrait of G. Frederick Reinhardt
Scopenote: Portrait of G. Frederick Reinhardt, which was used in his oral history.  During the administration of President Harry S. Truman, he was a foreign service officer at Moscow, 1945-1947; Consul General, 1947; Chief, Division of Eastern European Affairs in the Department of State, 1948-1950; Director, Office of Easter European Affairs, 1950; and Counsellor of Embassy, Paris, 1951-1955.  Donor: G. Frederick Reinhardt.

title: Portrait of Harry N. Rosenfield
Scopenote: Portrait of Harry N. Rosenfield, which was used in his Oral History interview.  Principal attorney and assistant to Federal Security Administrator, 1942-48; Member, United States Delegation to the United Nations Economic and Social Council (Geneva, Switzerland), 1948; Commissioner, United States Displaced Persons Commission, 1948-52; and Executive Director, President's Commission on Immigration and Naturalization, 1952-53.

title: Portrait of Jules Moch
Scopenote: Portrait of Jules Moch that was used with his oral history interview.  During the administration of Harry S. Truman, he was Minister of Public Works in the French Government, 1945-1947; Minister of the Interior and Vice-Prime Minister, 1947-1949, and in Bidault Cabinet, 1949-1950; and Minister of Defense, 1950-1951.  Donor: Jules Moch.

title: Portrait of Dennis A. Fitzgerald
Scopenote: Portrait of Dennis A. Fitzgerald which was used in his oral history interview.  During the administration of President Harry S. Truman, he was Director of Office of Requirements and Allocations, and Special Economic Advisor to the War Food Administrator, 1945; Director, Office of Requirements and Allocations of the Production Marketing Administration, and Special Economic Advisor to the War Food Administrator, 1945; United States deputy member on the Combined Food Board, 1945; Director, Office of Foreign Agricultural Relations, 1948-1949; Secretary-General, International Emergency Food Council, 1946-1948; appointed chief food consultant to Herbert Hoover on President's World Food Mission, 1946, and to President's Economic Mission to Germany and Austria, 1947; special consultant to Secretary of War, visiting U. S. and English zones of Germany, 1947; Director, Food and Agriculture Division, Economic Cooperation Administration, 1948-1951; Assistant Administrator, ECA, 1951-1952; Associate Deputy Director, Mutual Security Agency, 1952; and Deputy Director, Foreign Operations Administration, 1953.

title: Portrait of Martin Friedman
Scopenote: Portrait of Martin Leonard Friedman at the podium as President of the National Capital Democratic Club (now the National Democratic Club).  This photograph was used in Mr. Friedman's oral history interview.  During the administration of President Harry S. Truman, Mr. Friedman was a special assistant in the White House, 1950-1953.  Donor: Martin Friedman.

title: Portrait of Sterling Goddard
Scopenote: Portrait of Sterling Goddard which was used in his oral History interview. Longtime acquaintance of the Truman family; mortician in Grandview, Missouri, 1952 to the present; past President of the Grandview Chamber of Commerce; President, Harry S. Truman Farm Home Foundation, 1980.

title: Portrait of John M. Begg
Scopenote: Portrait of John M. Begg used in his oral history interview. Donor: Mr. Begg.

title: Portrait of Sir Eric Roll
Scopenote: Portrait of Sir Eric Roll (Lord Roll of Ipsden), which was used in his oral history interview.  During the administration of President Harry S. Truman, he was a member and later Deputy Head, British Food Mission to North America, 1941-1946; United Kingdom Deputy Member and U.K. Executive Officer, Combined Food Board, Washington, D. C., until 1946; Assistant Secretary, Ministry of Food, 1946-1947; Under Secretary, H.M. Treasury (Central Economic Planning Staff), 1948; Minister, U.K. Delegation to O.E.E.C., 1949; Deputy Head, U.K. Delegation to NATO, Paris, 1952; and Under Secretary, Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food, 1953-1957.   Donor: Sir Eric Roll.

title: Portrait of Hoyt Walkup
Scopenote: Portrait of Hoyt Walkup used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Walkup.

title: Portrait of Edwin M. Martin
Scopenote: Portrait of Edwin M. Martin which was used in his oral History interview. During the Truman Administration, was Chief, Division of Japanese and Korean Economic Affairs, Department of State, 1945-47; Chief, Division of Occupied Area Economic Affairs, 1947-48; Deputy Director, Office of International Trade Policy, 1948-49; Director, Office of European Regional Affairs, 1949-52; and Special Assistant to Secretary of State for Mutual Security Affairs, 1952-53.

title: Portrait of Roy Harper
Scopenote: Portrait of Judge Roy Harper used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Judge Harper.

title: Thomas Hart Benton sketching an Elderly Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left), seated in his office at his home. Painter Thomas Hart Benton (right) is sketching Mr. Truman for his painting "The Old President". Similar to 72-315 through 72-322.  From: Truman home.

title: Portrait of Giovanni Malagodi
Scopenote: Portrait of Giovanni Malagodi which was used in his oral history interview.  During the administration of Harry S. Truman, he was Central Manager of Banca Commerciale Italiana, 1947, and of an affiliated bank in Paris and South America, 1937-1947; Economic and Financial Advisor, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 1947; member of Italian delegation to Organization for European Economic Cooperation, 1947-1953; Chairman, OEEC Manpower Committee, 1950; and Liberal Party member of Chamber of Deputies, and in 1979 of Senate, for Milan, 1953-.

title: Portrait of William P. N. Edwards
Scopenote: Portrait of William P. N. Edwards which was used in his oral history interview.  During World War II and the administration of President Harry S. Truman, he was Assistant to the Chairman of British Supply Council, Ministry of Supply, 1941-1943; head of Industrial Information Division, Ministry of Production; alternate Director of Information, British Supply Council, Washington, D. C., 1943-1945; Director, Overseas Information Division, Board of Trade, London, 1945-1946; Counsellor, British Embassy, Washington, D. C., in charge of British Information Services, 1946-1949; Deputy Overseas Director, Federation of British Industries, 1949-1951; and Director, Promotion and Information, 1951-1965.  Donor: William P. N. Edwards.

title: Portrait of Maxine Williams
Scopenote: Portrait of Maxine Williams used in her oral history interview.  Mrs. Williams lived in the Truman farm home in Grandview, Missouri from 1956 to 1983, and was a tenant on the farm from 1954.  Donor: Mrs. Williams.

title: Portrait of Mr. and Mrs. Henry L. Deimel
Scopenote: Portrait of Dr. and Mrs. Henry L. Deimel which was used in Dr. Deimel's oral history interview.  The picture was taken at Thomas House, Washington, D.C.

title: Portrait of Margaret Weddle
Scopenote: Portrait of Margaret Weddle used in her oral history interview.  Ms. Weddle was a longtime acquaintance of the Truman family in Grandview, Missouri; descendant of Grandview area pioneers; and member of Mary Jane Truman's Sunday school class.

title: Portrait of Ted Sanders
Scopenote: Portrait of Ted Sanders, age 88, which was used in his oral history interview.  Sanders was a longtime friend of the Truman family, local Works Progress Administrator, farmer, and horse-trader.  Donor: Ted Sanders.
